newsitem.title: FRANCE: Frenchman jailed in hostage-taking "suicide" bid.
newsitem.headline: Frenchman jailed in hostage-taking "suicide" bid.

text.p: A French court has jailed a man for 30 months after he took schoolchildren hostage last year, hoping in a bizarre bid of suicide by proxy that police would shoot him dead, justice sources said on Friday.

Nicolas Gaillard told the court he got his idea after a 1993 hostage drama in which a man wired to explosives and calling himself "human bomb" held children for 48 hours in a suburban Paris school until an elite police squad killed him.
Gaillard, carrying a pistol with blank cartridges, stormed a classroom in the Paris suburb of Clichy-la-Garenne last December. He told the court he had "hoped sharpshooters would not miss me".
But he broke down after a few hours and released the children.
He had written to his parents: "I wanted my death to be a success since my life was not. I am sorry I was born."
The Paris court sentenced him on Thursday to 30 months in prison with a further 30-month term suspended.
